intro: Hexalobus monopetalus var. parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved single-petaled hexalobus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The flowers are solitary and consist of a single petal, which is a defining feature of the species. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
